page.title: 16A Day in the Life of Kay
page.content: As an ordinary housewife I am up first and wake the family about 7.15 am. While they wash, dress and have breakfast I prepare packed lunches for Alan to take to work, and Lucy and Ben to take to school. After taking the children to school I do the routine housework, loading the washing machine, making beds, cleaning, hoovering etc. I then find time to write a couple of reports for the local newspaper, for which I am village correspondent. When I have collected the children at 3 pm, there is time to potter in the garden before preparing and cooking the evening meal. A typical menu is liver and bacon with creamed potatoes and carrots, followed by semolina. By 8.30 pm the children are in bed, and Alan and I relax, perhaps watching television or listening to music.
